text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Anti-corruption prosecutor to deal with final stages of "Banesto affair"
- Government yields to PNV requests in economic accord
- Scientists prove that "mad cow disease" can be transmitted to humans
EL MUNDO
- Aznar succeeds in gaining support of "centrist majority" for his budget
- The "conceited little rat pack"
DIARIO 16
- Little girls that robbed bank belong to international network
- The first 20 years in freedom
ABC
- Parliament lends support with absolute majority for Aznar's first budget
- Aznar offers to dictator Castro his support in a transition to a democracy in Cuba
LA VANGUARDIA
- New steps to lower mortgage costs
- Courts require parking to watch cars at night
- Barca consolidates its position as leader
CINCO DIAS
- Pique eludes CNMV in Ercros
- Fund managers are earning commissions of 20 percent of fund return
- Changing mortgage will be less expensive
EXPANSION
- Endesa accepts limit of its power of management in Sevillana and Fecsa
- Ministry of Economy announces measures to lower mortgage rates
- PNV backs budget in exchange for new fiscal powers
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Ministry of Industry delays sale of Viesgo and Nansa until December
- Santander finalises purchase of majority of fourth-largest Mexican bank
